en.aboutString:
Mergesort Algorithm Visualization
Written by Daniel Breakiron
Created as part of the OpenDSA hypertextbook project.
For more information, see http://algoviz.org/OpenDSA
Source and development history available at
https://github.com/OpenDSA/OpenDSA
Compiled with JSAV library version
en.arrValsPlaceholder: Type space-separated values, or hit 'run' to use random values
en.c3: An array of length 1 cannot be split, ready for merge
en.c4: Split the selected array (as evenly as possible)
en.c7: Merge selected arrays back together, in sorted order
en.c8: When one list becomes empty, copy all values from the remaining array into the sorted array
en.c9: Select the smallest value from the front of each list (excluding values already in the sorted array)
en.c10: Select the minimum of the two values
en.c11: Add the selected value to the sorted array

Mergesort Algorithm Visualization
Written by Daniel Breakiron
Created as part of the OpenDSA hypertextbook project.
For more information, see http://algoviz.org/OpenDSA
Source and development history available at
https://github.com/OpenDSA/OpenDSA
Compiled with JSAV library version
fi.arrValsPlaceholder: XType space-separated values, or hit 'run' to use random values
fi.c3: An array of length 1 cannot be split, ready for merge
fi.c4: Split the selected array (as evenly as possible)
fi.c7: Merge selected arrays back together, in sorted order
fi.c8: When one list becomes empty, copy all values from the remaining array into the sorted array
fi.c9: Select the smallest value from the front of each list (excluding values already in the sorted array)
fi.c10: Select the minimum of the two values
fi.c11: Add the selected value to the sorted array
